sentences.en: Bertha found Miss Ley tried hard to suppress her amusement.
sentences.cn: 伯莎发现莱伊小姐竭力掩饰着内心的快活.

sentences.en: Chu Yin - chiu was the first to see them, and he could not suppress a start.
sentences.cn: 朱吟秋猛转脸看见, 把不住心头一跳.

sentences.en: Even the grave young woman could not suppress a smile.
sentences.cn: 连那个严肃的年轻妇女都禁不住笑了.

sentences.en: He found himself completely unable to suppress a sense of disappointment, of letdown.
sentences.cn: 他感到自己有一种完全无法抑制的受挫和失望的感觉.

sentences.en: He turned back to the girls , who were trying to suppress their smiles.
sentences.cn: 他回过头来看着几位姑娘.她们正强忍着笑呢.

sentences.en: Her voice was pitched unusually low to suppress the quaver.
sentences.cn: 她声音异常沉着,好把嗓子里的震颤压下去.

sentences.en: Hung - chien was so astonished that he could not suppress a cry.
sentences.cn: 鸿 渐 惊异得忍不住叫“咦”!

sentences.en: It is probable that the medication will suppress the symptom without treating the condition.
sentences.cn: 这种药物有可能治标不治本。

sentences.en: No one may suppress such complaints , charges and exposures, or retaliate against the citizens making them.
sentences.cn: 任何人不得压制和打击报复.

sentences.en: Patsy had to clench her jaw to suppress her anger.
sentences.cn: 帕奇只得咬紧牙关压住怒气。

sentences.en: She was struggling to suppress her sobs.
sentences.cn: 她拼命不让自己哭出来.

sentences.en: The answer is very simple: never suppress a dependent source in a superposition problem.
sentences.cn: 回答很简单: 在迭加问题中,非独立源永远不要去掉.

sentences.en: The imperialists are trying in vain to suppress the liberation movement in the colonies.
sentences.cn: 帝国主义者妄图镇压殖民地的解放运动.

sentences.en: The police are trying to suppress the seller of dangerous drugs.
sentences.cn: 警方正试图清剿毒品贩.

sentences.en: The police were accused of suppressing evidence.

sentences.cn: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

sentences.en: You shall never force him to suppress the facts of his life.
sentences.cn: 你绝对不能强迫他把过去生活中的那些事实隐瞒起来.

words.tran_cn: 制止的；抑制性的；遏抑的
镇压，禁止（suppress的过去时和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

trans.tran_cn: 镇压，压制，止住，忍住，禁止发表，阻止…的生长（或发展）
trans.tran_en: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force
